info.name: iStruct API Documentation
info.description:
## Documentation

https://api.istruct.com/

## Authorization

To access any endpoint (except fetching access token) you have to be authorized. We use [The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749) to grant you access.

Every endpoint requires corresponding scope granted to the client. Scopes can be configured when creating API client. Additionally, every client can be limited to chosen zones and warehouses, which limits which entities can be obtained through API.

## Conventions

All communication is done in REST way and JSON format is used for each request and response.

Every endpoint conforms to open source JSON API 1.0 Specification. You can find everything you need to know about this format in official docs on http://jsonapi.org.



## Filtering

JSON API does not impose filtering params format (http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-filtering) so we chose to use it in array like notation.

To use a filter `someFilter` you need to send it as `filter[someFilter]=someValue` query parameter.

Of course you can combine multiple filters like this:

`?filter[someFilter]=someValue&filter[otherFilter]=otherValue`

Some filters allow multiple values. You can pass them in multidimensional array like manner:

`?filter[someFilter][]=firstValue&filter[someFilter][]=secondValue`

This will filter out all records that contain either `firstValue` or `secondValue` in related field.

Please remember that any value that contains URL unsafe characters has to be URL-encoded according to [RFC 3986](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986) or [RFC 1738](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1738).



## Pagination

JSON API is agnostic about pagination strategy (http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination) too so we chose to use page-based strategy.

By default you will fetch first page and first 25 records (other default page size can be specified by endpoints). You can get information about total records count, current page or current page size from `meta` (http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-meta) information.

To fetch other pages or more data you need to send it as `page[number]=2&page[size]=10` query parameters.

Maximum page size may be limited and can be specified by endpoints to prevent sending too much data over single request.



## Data formats

All data is typecasted to best JSON variable formats possible. So numbers are numbers, booleans are booleans and all the rest scalar values are probably strings.

Datetimes in responses are always returned in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard with timezones support. Also when using Datetime filtering you MUST use this format (URL-encoded).

Booleans in query params can be represented as: `1`, `true` or `0`, `false`.


## Error responses

First of all you should always check first for HTTP Code (`2xx` - OK, `4xx` - User Request Errors, `5xx` - Server Internal Errors).

When an error occurs it should always contain `error` and `message` fields in response JSON which should help you resolve the issue.

When everything is fine, response will be in JSON API format.

item.name: Authorization

urlencoded.description: Space separated list of scopes, for example "shop_packages:get shop_orders:get". Parameter can be omitted to obtain all scopes available to client.

request.description: Generates new OAuth2 JWT token for current client.

response.name: Fetch new token with limited scopes

item.description:
To interact with other endpoints your requests have to be authorized using OAuth2 access token.

To obtain a token your application can get it in exchange for API Keys using client credentials grant (id and secret).

item.name: Resources
Shop
Order

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_orders:get`

**Available filters**

| Name                    | Type     | Description                                                             |
|-------------------------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| code                    | string   | Exact order code                                                        |
| currency                | string   | Exact order currency                                                    |
| currentStatusId         | int/int[]| One or more status IDs (see **Order statuses** below)                   |
| createdFrom             | datetime | `>=` Date when order has been created                                   |
| createdTo               | datetime | `<=` Date when order has been created                                   |
| paidFrom                | datetime | `>=` Date when order has been marked as paid                            |
| paidTo                  | datetime | `>=` Date when order has been marked as paid                            |
| warehouseId             | int      | Internal ID of the warehouse                                            |

**Available sortings**

* id
* createdAt
* paidAt

**Order statuses**

| Status ID | Status name        |
|-----------|--------------------|
| 1         | new                |
| 2         | paid               |
| 3         | realized           |
| 4         | sent               |
| 5         | delivered          |
| 6         | returned           |
| 7         | cancelled          |
| 8         | new autoship       |
| 9         | autoship accepted  |

response.name: Fetch multiple orders
Fetch delivered orders

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_orders:get`

**Order attributes**

| Name                    | Type     | Nullable | Description                                                                         |
|-------------------------|----------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| code                    | string   | No       | Auto generated, unique order code                                                   |
| currency                | string   | No       | Payment currency symbol ([ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) format) |
| amount                  | float    | No       | Total amount for order in `currency`                                                |
| points                  | float    | No       | Total points for order (for calculating commissions)                                |
| orderer.name            | string   | No       | Entity that placed this order                                                       |
| orderer.isCompany       | bool     | No       | Whether order has been placed on behalf of a company entity                         |
| orderer.companyName     | string   | Yes      | When `isCompany = true` this name is filled                                         |
| orderer.phone           | string   | No       | Phone number of orderer                                                             |
| orderer.email           | string   | No       | E-mail address of orderer                                                           |
| orderer.address.countryId | string | No       | [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code |
| orderer.address.postalCode| string | No       | Orderer postal code                                                                 |
| orderer.address.regionCode| string | Yes      | When countryId is USA, this will contain two-letter ANSI state code; otherwise it will be null |
| orderer.address.regionName| string | Yes      | This will contain region name (in english), if user chose region; otherwise it will be null |
| orderer.address.cityName  | string | No       | Orderer city name                                                                   |
| orderer.address.street    | string | No       | Orderer address (street, home number, apartment number                              |
| orderer.address.annotations | string | Yes    | Orderer annotations or remarks regarding this order                                 |
| orderer.vatNumber       | string   | Yes      | When `isCompany = true` this number is filled (used for invoicing)                  |
| orderer.isVatEu         | bool     | No       | Whether `vatNumber` is an EU VAT Number                                             |
| delivery.name           | string   | No       | Order receiver name                                                                 |
| delivery.phone          | string   | No       | Phone number for delivery                                                           |
| delivery.countryId      | string   | No       | [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code |
| delivery.postalCode     | string   | No       | Delivery postal code                                                                |
| delivery.regionCode     | string   | Yes      | When countryId is USA, this will contain two-letter ANSI state code; otherwise it will be null |
| delivery.regionName     | string   | Yes      | This will contain region name (in english), if user chose region; otherwise it will be null |
| delivery.cityName       | string   | No       | Delivery city name                                                                  |
| delivery.street         | string   | No       | Delivery address (street, home number, apartment number                             |
| createdAt               | datetime | No       | Date when order has been placed                                                     |
| currentStatusId         | bool     | No       | Current order status (see **Order statuses** table)                                 |
| currentStatusUpdatedAt  | datetime | No       | Date when order has reached current status                                          |
| shipSalesDocument       | bool     | No       | Whether physical copy of sales document should be inserted into package? (Customer wish) |

**Relationships**

* payment - Order `Payment` object
* shipment - Order `Shipment` object
* items - Order `Item` collection
* orderAdjustments - Order `Adjustment` collection
* connectedOrders - Orders connected to this order
* salesDocument - An `Invoice` object or null

response.name: Fetch single order

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_orders:get`

**Item attributes**

| Name                    | Type     | Nullable | Description                                                                         |
|-------------------------|----------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| id                      | int      | No       | ID of shop item                                                                     |
| number                  | int      | No       | Ordinal number of product in order                                                  |
| name                    | string   | No       | Product name                                                                        |
| code                    | string   | No       | Product item code shown in eCommerce                                                |
| barcode                 | string   | Yes      | Product item barcode                                                                |
| warehouseCode           | string   | No       | Product item warehouse code                                                         |
| quantity                | int      | No       | Purchased product quantity                                                          |
| price                   | float    | No       | Product price per single unit; includes VAT, but doesn't include US sales tax                                                       |
| points                  | float    | No       | Product points per single unit (used for commissions calculation)                   |
| taxPercent              | float    | No       | Product VAT percent                                                                 |
| weight                  | float    | No       | Product weight per single unit                                                      |
| orderId                 | int      | No       | ID of order to which this item belongs                                              |

**Required scope**: `shop_orders:get`

**Adjustment attributes**

| Name                    | Type     | Nullable | Description                                                                         |
|-------------------------|----------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| orderId                 | int      | No       | ID of parent order                                                                  |
| adjustmentId            | string   | No       | ID of adjustment                                                                    |
| typeId                  | int      | No       | ID of adjustment type (see Adjustment types endpoint to fetch all possible values)  |
| typeName                | string   | No       | Internal name of adjustment type                                                    |
| amount                  | float    | No       | Amount in order currency. It shows effective amount, so voucher for 50USD used for order with total amount of 40USD will only show -40 in this field. This value will be negative for discounts, positive for additional charges, like sales tax. |
| points                  | float    | No       | Amount of points that were added to (positive value) or deducted from (negative value) order. |
| price                   | float    | No       | Product price per single unit                                                       |
| params                  | object   | No       | Adjustment params depend on your iStruct configuration and available types. Example fields include label, description and voucherCode       |

response.name: Fetch order adjustments

request.description: **Required scope**: `shop_orders:get`

response.name: Fetch order connected orders

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_orders:get`

**Payment attributes**

| Name                    | Type     | Nullable | Description                                                                         |
|-------------------------|----------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| typeId                  | int      | No       | ID of payment type                                                                  |
| name                    | string   | No       | Payment type name                                                                   |
| amount                  | float    | No       | Payment amount                                                                      |
| orderId                 | int      | No       | ID of order to which this payment belongs                                           |

**Required scope**: `shop_orders:get`

**Shipment attributes**

| Name                    | Type     | Nullable | Description                                                                         |
|-------------------------|----------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| typeId                  | int      | No       | ID of shipment type                                                                 |
| isCod                   | bool     | No       | Whether shipment is COD                                                             |
| name                    | string   | No       | Shipment type name                                                                  |
| cost                    | float    | No       | Shipment cost (including VAT, but not sales tax)                                      |
| orderId                 | int      | No       | ID of order to which this shipment belongs                                          |

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_orders:get`

**Sales document attributes**

| Name                    | Type     | Nullable | Description                                                                         |
|-------------------------|----------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| title                   | string   | No       | Title of sales document                                                             |
| currency                | string   | No       | Currency of document                                                                |
| amount                  | float    | No       | Total amount on document                                                            |
| soldAt                  | datetime | No       | Datetime of sale                                                                    |
| issuedAt                | datetime | No       | Datetime of document issuing                                                        |
| file.name               | string   | No       | Document file name                                                                  |
| file.extension          | string   | No       | Document file extension (pdf)                                                       |
| file.mime               | string   | No       | Document file mimetype (application/pdf)                                            |
| file.size               | int      | No       | Document file size in bytes (before base64 encoding)                                |
| file.contents           | string   | No       | Document file contents encoded in base64                                            |
| orderId                 | int      | No       | ID of order to which this sales document belongs                                    |

**Required scope**: `shop_orders:post`

**Order attributes**

| Name                    | Type        | Required | Description                                                                         |
|-------------------------|-------------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| orderer                 | array       | No       | If this field is skipped entirely, data from user's profile will be used            |
| orderer.nameFirst       | string      | Yes      | First name of entity that placed this order                                         |
| orderer.nameLast        | string      | Yes      | Last name of entity that placed this order                                          |
| orderer.isCompany       | bool        | Yes      | Whether order has been placed on behalf of a company entity                         |
| orderer.companyName     | string or null | Yes/No   | This is required when `isCompany = true`                                            |
| orderer.phone           | string      | Yes      | Phone number of orderer                                                             |
| orderer.email           | string      | Yes      | E-mail address of orderer                                                           |
| orderer.address.countryId | string    | Yes      | [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code |
| orderer.address.regionCode | string   | Yes/No   | This field might be required for some addresses, depending on configuration of your iStruct instance. It contains 2-letter state/region/land code. |
| orderer.address.postalCode| string    | Yes      | Orderer postal code                                                                 |
| orderer.address.cityName  | string    | Yes      | Orderer city name                                                                   |
| orderer.address.street    | string    | Yes      | Orderer address (street, home number, apartment number                              |
| orderer.address.annotations | string or null  | No      | Orderer annotations or remarks regarding this order                                 |
| orderer.vatNumber       | string or null      | Yes/No      | When `isCompany = true` this number is required (used for invoicing)                  |
| delivery                | array       | No       | If this field is skipped entirely, default user's address will be used           |
| delivery.nameFirst      | string      | Yes      | Order receiver first name                                                          |
| delivery.nameLast       | string      | Yes      | Order receiver last name                                                            |
| delivery.phone          | string      | Yes      | Phone number for delivery                                                           |
| delivery.countryId      | string      | Yes      | [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code |
| delivery.regionCode     | string      | Yes/No   | This field might be required for some addresses, depending on configuration of your iStruct instance. It contains 2-letter state/region/land code.
| delivery.postalCode     | string      | Yes      | Delivery postal code                                                                |
| delivery.cityName       | string      | Yes      | Delivery city name                                                                  |
| delivery.street         | string      | Yes      | Delivery address (street, home number, apartment number                             |
| shipSalesDocument       | bool        | Yes/No   | Whether physical copy of sales document should be inserted into package (customer wish). Depends on your iStruct instance configuration, may be disabled. |
| items.[].code           | string      | Yes      | Item code of ordered product                                                     |
| items.[].quantity       | integer     | Yes      | Ordered quantity of given item                                                      |
| shipmentTypeCode        | string      | Yes      | Shipment type code, which can be fetched via **ShipmentType** endpoint                |
| paymentTypeCode        | string       | Yes      | Payment type code, which can be fetched via **PaymentType** endpoint                   |

**Relationships**


| Name                    | Required | Description                                                                         |
|-------------------------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| user                    | Yes      | iStruct's user that makes this order                                                |
| warehouse               | No       | if your iStruct instance allows users to directly change the warehouse they are ordering from, you can change it here as well. Otherwise, this field is not directly accessible. |
| tags                    | No       | List of tags that should be added to this order                                     |

response.name: Add single order

item.description: Shop Order contains at least one product **Item**, exactly one **Shipment** and exactly one **Payment** objects. It can contain zero or more **Connected Orders**, zero or exactly one **Sales Document** objects and zero ore more **OrderAdjustment**

item.name: Package

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_packages:get`

**Available filters**

| Name                    | Type     | Description                                                             |
|-------------------------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| cancelled               | bool     | Has package been cancelled?                                             |
| carrierName             | string   | Exact carrier name                                                      |
| createdFrom             | datetime | `>=` Date when package has been created                                 |
| createdTo               | datetime | `<=` Date when package has been created                                 |
| delivered               | bool     | Has package been delivered?                                             |
| sent                    | bool     | Has package been sent?                                                  |
| trackingNumber          | string   | Exact tracking number                                                   |

**Available sortings**

* id
* createdAt

response.name: Fetch not sent and not cancelled packages
Fetch multiple packages

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_packages:get`

**Package attributes**

| Name                    | Type     | Nullable | Description                                                                         |
|-------------------------|----------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| trackingNumber          | string   | Yes      | Package tracking number                                                             |
| trackingUrl             | string   | Yes      | Tracking URL (to external carrier service)                                          |
| carrierName             | string   | Yes      | Carrier of package                                                                  |
| receiver.name           | string   | No       | Entity that is a receiver of package                                                |
| receiver.phone          | string   | No       | Phone number of receiver                                                            |
| receiver.countryId      | string   | No       | [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code |
| receiver.postalCode     | string   | No       | Delivery postal code                                                                |
| receiver.cityName       | string   | No       | Delivery city name                                                                  |
| receiver.street         | string   | No       | Delivery address (street, home number, apartment number                             |
| shipment.isCod          | bool     | No       | Whether this parcel should be COD                                                   |
| shipment.codAmount      | float    | No       | COD amount (important when `shipment.isCod` is `true`)                              |
| shipment.codCurrency    | string   | No       | COD currency symbol ([ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) format, important when `shipment.isCod` is `true`) |
| createdAt               | datetime | No       | Date when package has been created                                                  |
| sent                    | bool     | No       | Has package been sent? (Passed to external package handling service)                |
| delivered               | bool     | No       | Has package been delivered?                                                         |
| deliveredAt             | datetime | Yes      | Date when package has been delivered                                                |
| cancelled               | bool     | No       | Has package been cancelled?                                                         |

**Relationships**

* mainOrder - Package main `Order` object
* mainShipment - Package `Shipment` object

response.name: Fetch single package
Fetch single package with main order included

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_packages:get`

See `Order` endpoints for details about this response.

response.name: Fetch package main order

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_packages:get`

See `Order` endpoints for details about this response.

**Required scope**: `shop_packages:put`

You can mark Package as sent by sending PUT request with `sent` field set to `true`.

Please be warned - once Package is marked as sent, **it cannot be unmarked**.

Marking package as sent also changes statuses of related Orders to sent.

You can send package tracking details alongside `sent` field too.

response.name: Marked package as sent
Mark package and set tracking details

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_packages:put`

You can mark Package as delivered by sending PUT request with `delivered` field set to `true`.

Please be warned - once Package is marked as delivered, **it cannot be unmarked**.

Marking package as delivered also changes statuses of related Orders to delivered.

Package has to be marked as sent first in order to mark it as delivered.

response.name: Mark package as delivered

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_packages:put`

You can set tracking details of package:

* Tracking number
* Tracking URL
* Carrier name

response.name: Set package tracking details

item.description: Packages aggregate Orders into a single entity that allows one or more of them to be shipped in one parcel. Package contains one **Main Order** that defines delivery address and shipment type. Main order can contain zero or more **Connected Orders** that should be shipped all together.

item.name: Channels

request.description: **Required scope**: `shop_dictionaries:get`

header.value: {"notice":[{"message":"Key file \"file:\/\/\/home\/vagrant\/code\/kannaway\/data\/ssl\/oauth2-server.crt\" permissions are not correct, should be 600 or 660 instead of 664","file":"\/home\/vagrant\/code\/kannaway\/vendor\/league\/oauth2-server\/src\/CryptKey.php","line":56,"type":"PHP Notice"}]}

item.description: This endpoint allows to fetch shop channels. Channels are separate places where Products can be purchased. These are predefined by other modules that are available in the system (ex. Online shop, Autoship, Admin orders). You can assign Products to be available only in specified channels.

item.name: ShipmentType

request.description: **Required scope**: `shop_dictionaries:get`

item.description: This endpoint returns information about shipment methods available in your iStruct instance via API. Every shipment type has a unique code, which is required when creating **Order** via api.

item.name: PaymentType

request.description: **Required scope**: `shop_dictionaries:get`

item.description: This endpoint returns information about payment methods available in your iStruct instance via API. Every payment type has a unique code, which is required when creating **Order** via api.

item.name: AdjustmentType

request.description: **Required scope**: `shop_dictionaries:get`

item.description: This endpoint returns information about adjustment types available in your iStruct instance via API. Adjustments are things that affect either order value (e. g. discounts, sales tax) or payment amount (e. g. vouchers, partial payments from wallet).

request.description: **Required scope**: `shop_products:get`

item.name: Product

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_products:get`

**Available filters**

| Name        | Type      | Description                             |
|:------------|:----------|:----------------------------------------|
| active      | bool      | Is product active?                      |
| code        | string    | Exact product code                      |
| channelId   | int/int[] | One or more shop channel Ids            |
| createdFrom | datetime  | `>=` Date when product has been created |
| createdTo   | datetime  | `<=` Date when product has been created |
| statusId    | int/int[] | One or more user status IDs             |
| typeId      | int       | Exact product type ID                   |

**Available sortings**

* createdAt
* id

response.name: Fetch multiple products

request.description:
##### Product attributes

| Name      | Type     | Description                                                                          |
|:----------|:---------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| code      | string   | Code (SKU)                                                                           |
| languages | object   | Product names.                                                                       |
| order     | integer  | Ordinal number (positive or negative). It is used to sort products on product lists. |
| createdAt | datetime | Date and time when product was created.                                              |
| active    | boolean  | When Product is active, all its active Items are shown in Channels.                  |

##### Product relationships

| Name       | Description                                                                                                                 |
|:-----------|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| categories | List of Shop categories in which Product is listed (full list can be fetched from `/api/v1/shop/categories`).               |
| channels   | List of Shop channels in which Product is listed (full list can be fetched from `/api/v1/shop/channels`).                   |
| items      | List of Product Items of this Product.                                                                                      |
| type       | Relationship to product type (full list can be fetched from `/api/v1/shop/products-types`).                                 |
| statuses   | List of User statuses for which Product is available for purchase (full list can be fetched from `/api/v1/users/statuses`). |

**Required scope**: `shop_products:get`

Please refer to Shop / ProductType endpoints documentation for more details.

header.value: {"notice":[{"message":"Key file \"file:\/\/\/home\/vagrant\/code\/kannaway\/data\/ssl\/oauth2-server.crt\" permissions are not correct, should be 600 or 660 instead of 664","file":"\/home\/vagrant\/code\/kannaway\/vendor\/league\/oauth2-server\/src\/CryptKey.php","line":56,"type":"PHP Notice"}]}

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_products:get`

**Available filters**

| Name        | Type      | Description                             |
|:------------|:----------|:----------------------------------------|
| active      | bool      | Is product item active?                 |
| code        | string    | Exact product item code                 |
| zoneId      | int/int[] | One or more zone IDs                    |

**Available sortings**

* id

response.name: Fetch product items

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_products:get`

##### Product item attributes

| Name                | Type     | Description                                                                                     |
|:--------------------|:---------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| code                | string   | Code                                                                                     |
| minimalStock        | integer  | Minimal stock of this item.                                                                     |
| emptyStockMessage   | string   | This message is shown in some Channels when item is out of stock.                               |
| availableFrom       | datetime | Availability date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, item is always available. |
| availableTo         | datetime | Availability date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, item is always available. |
| active              | boolean  | Inactive items are not shown in Channels.                                                       |
| warehouseCode       | string   | Warehouse item code                                   |

##### Product item relationships

| Name   | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|:-------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| prices | List of Product Item prices (Please refer to "Fetch product item prices" endpoint documentation for more details).                                                                                                           |
| tax    | Relationship to Tax (full list can be fetched from `/api/v1/zones/:id/relationships/taxes`). |
| zone   | Relationship to main Product Item Zone (full list can be fetched from `/api/v1/zones`).                                                                                                                                      |
**Required scope**: `shop_products:get`
**Required scope**: `shop_products:get`
**Required scope**: `shop_products:get`

**Required scope**: `shop_products:get`

##### Price attributes

| Name     | Type     | Description                                                                                                                                           |
|:---------|:---------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| type     | string   | Can be one of: `status`, `promotion`, `active`.                                           |
| currency | string   | ISO 4217 currency symbol.                                                                                                                             |
| value    | decimal  | Unit price value in Zone currency.                                                                                                                    |
| points   | decimal  | Unit points value.                                                                                                                                    |
| statusId | integer  | Price targeting by User status ID (can be fetched from `/api/v1/users/statuses`). *Non empty only for type `promotion` and `status`.                  |
| from     | datetime | Promotional price effective date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, price is always effective. Non empty only for type `promotion`. |
| to       | datetime | Promotional price effective date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, price is always effective. Non empty only for type `promotion`. |


**Available filters**

| Name     | Type   | Description                                                                                                 |
|:---------|:-------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| type     | string | Can be one of: `status`, `promotion`, `active`. |
| statusId | int    | User status ID (can be fetched from `/api/v1/users/statuses`).                                              |

**Available sortings**

* type
* value
* points
* from
* to

**Required scope**: `shop_products:post`

You CAN create a complete shop product through this endpoint.

You CAN set product as `active` only when there is at least one `active`
product item added in the same request.

You CAN set relationships to shop categories, shop channels
(availability) and user statuses (user targeting).

You MUST provide at least one product name (in default language).

You MAY omit non-required parameters from request body.

##### Product attributes

| Name          | Type                      | Required | Description                                                  |
| :------------ | :------------------------ | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- |
| code          | string                    | Yes      | Code (SKU)                                                   |
| typeId        | integer                   | Yes      | Type ID (can be fetched from `/api/v1/shop/products-types` endpoint). |
| languages     | object                    | Yes      | Product names, English (`en`) translation is required.       |
| active        | boolean                   | Yes      | When Product is active, all its active Items are shown in Channels. |
| order         | integer                   | No       | Ordinal number (positive or negative). It is used to sort products on product lists. |
| items         | array of **Product item** | No       | Product items array (can be used to create items in the same request as product). |
| warehouseCode | string\|null              | Yes      | Assigns exist warehouse position. If value null provided will be created new warehouse position. |

##### Product item attributes

| Name                | Type               | Required | Description                                                  |
| :------------------ | :----------------- | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- |
| code                | string             | Yes      | Code (SKU)                                                   |
| zoneId              | integer            | Yes      | Zone ID (can be fetched from `/api/v1/zones` endpoint). It determines item availability, price currency etc. |
| taxId               | integer            | Yes  | VAT Tax ID (can be fetched from `/api/v1/zones/:id/relationships/taxes` endpoint). |
| retailPrice         | object             | Yes      | Retail unit price (object properties are described below).   |
| retailPrice.value   | decimal            | Yes      | Unit price value in Zone currency.                           |
| retailPrice.points  | decimal            | Yes      | Unit points value.                                           |
| active              | boolean            | Yes      | Inactive items are not shown in Channels.                    |
| prices              | array of **Price** | No       | Additional prices.                                           |
| minimalStock        | integer            | No       | Minimal stock of this item.                                  |
| emptyStockMessage   | string             | No       | This message is shown in some Channels when item is out of stock. |
| availableFrom       | datetime           | No       | Availability date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, item is always available. |
| availableTo         | datetime           | No       | Availability date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, item is always available. |
| warehouseCode       | string\|null       | Yes      | Assigns exist warehouse position. If value null provided will be created new warehouse position. |

##### Price attributes

| Name     | Type     | Required | Description                                                  |
| :------- | :------- | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- |
| type     | string   | Yes      | Can be one of: `status`, `promotion`, `active`. |
| value    | decimal  | Yes      | Unit price value in Zone currency.                           |
| points   | decimal  | Yes      | Unit points value.                                           |
| statusId | integer  | Yes/No*  | Price targeting by User status ID (can be fetched from `/api/v1/users/statuses`). *Required and can be set only for type `promotion` and `status`. |
| from     | datetime | No       | Promotional price effective date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, price is always effective. Can be set only for type `promotion`. |
| to       | datetime | No       | Promotional price effective date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, price is always effective. Can be set only for type `promotion`. |

##### Product relationships

| Name       | Required | Description                                                  |
| :--------- | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- |
| categories | No       | List of Shop categories in which Product is listed (can be fetched from `/api/v1/shop/categories`). |
| channels   | No       | List of Shop channels in which Product is listed (can be fetched from `/api/v1/shop/channels`). |
| statuses   | No       | List of User statuses for which Product is available for purchase (can be fetched from `/api/v1/users/statuses`). |

variable.description: Obtained after adding product with `/api/v1/shop/products` endpoint.

request.description:
**Required scope**: `shop_products:post`

You CAN create a product item for shop product through this endpoint.

You MAY omit non-required parameters from request body.

##### Product item attributes

| Name                | Type               | Required | Description                                                  |
| :------------------ | :----------------- | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- |
| code                | string             | Yes      | Code (SKU)                                                   |
| zoneId              | integer            | Yes      | Zone ID (can be fetched from `/api/v1/zones` endpoint). It determines item availability, price currency etc. |
| taxId               | integer            | Yes  | VAT Tax ID (can be fetched from `/api/v1/zones/:id/relationships/taxes` endpoint). |
| retailPrice         | object             | Yes      | Retail unit price (object properties are described below).   |
| retailPrice.value   | decimal            | Yes      | Unit price value in Zone currency.                           |
| retailPrice.points  | decimal            | Yes      | Unit points value.                                           |
| active              | boolean            | Yes      | Inactive items are not shown in Channels.                    |
| prices              | array of **Price** | No       | Additional prices.                                           |
| minimalStock        | integer            | No       | Minimal stock of this item.                                  |
| emptyStockMessage   | string             | No       | This message is shown in some Channels when item is out of stock. |
| availableFrom       | datetime           | No       | Availability date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, item is always available. |
| availableTo         | datetime           | No       | Availability date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, item is always available. |
| warehouseCode       | string\|null       | Yes      | Assigns exist warehouse position. If value null provided will be created new warehouse position. |

##### Price attributes

| Name     | Type     | Required | Description                                                  |
| :------- | :------- | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- |
| type     | string   | Yes      | Can be one of: `status`, `promotion`, `active`. |
| value    | decimal  | Yes      | Unit price value in Zone currency.                           |
| points   | decimal  | Yes      | Unit points value.                                           |
| statusId | integer  | Yes/No*  | Price targeting by User status ID (can be fetched from `/api/v1/users/statuses`). *Required and can be set only for type `promotion` and `status`. |
| from     | datetime | No       | Promotional price effective date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, price is always effective. Can be set only for type `promotion`. |
| to       | datetime | No       | Promotional price effective date range in ISO 8601 date and time format. When empty, price is always effective. Can be set only for type `promotion`. |

variable.description: Obtained after adding product with `/api/v1/shop/products` endpoint.

item.description:
Product catalog management endpoints. 

Each **Product** contains one or more **Product items**.

Each **Product item** contains **Retail price** and MAY contain additional **Prices**.

request.description: **Required scope**: `shop_products:get`
**Required scope**: `shop_products:get`

item.description: iStruct Shop modules support full eCommerce flow. Products and categories management, order and payment processing with external gateways, shipping packages via carriers or brokers, invoicing and much more.

item.description: iStruct Zones module handles access to various other resources on per zone basis. Each zone may consist of one or more delivery countries or regions. Whole zone has the same accounting rules, same currency, invoicing entity and other settings like default language, locale, timezone etc.
